steps.title: ð Be Specific, Not Dramatic
steps.content: Instead of 'My boss is evil,' try 'Boss forces overtime without pay, then takes credit for our work during board meetings.' Give us dates, examples, and context.

steps.title: ð¯ Focus on Patterns, Not Single Incidents
steps.content: One bad day doesn't make a toxic boss. But consistently humiliating employees, playing favorites, or creating impossible deadlines? That's the good stuff we need.

steps.title: ð Evidence is Everything
steps.content: Got emails? Screenshots? Written policies they violate? Upload that PDF! Nothing says 'legitimate complaint' like documented proof of their awfulness.

steps.title: ðµï¸ Protect Yourself
steps.content: Use an anonymous email if you're worried. We protect whistleblowers, but your boss probably doesn't. Stay safe while fighting the good fight.

steps.title: ð¯ The More Detail, The Better
steps.content: Think investigative journalism meets workplace therapy session. What makes them toxic? How do they operate? What's their damage to team morale?
